chargeHist.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

result.execSummary:
The defendant WAYLON R. THIEX was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. WAYLON R. THIEX

records.addlTxt: copies of receipts with no direction on what to do
Shawano County DNA Proof of Submission obtained today.

11:40 AM Defendant WAYLON R. THIEX in court.  Attorney Carly Jo Foor Ms. appeared by video for WAYLON R. THIEX.  Prosecuting attorney Mark s Williams in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Atty. Williams places joint recommendation on the record.  Count 2 would be amended to a misdemeanor.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to count 1 and amended count 2.Court advises party of their rights, gives citizenship/deportation admonition, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty. Remarks by Atty. Foor.  Court makes its findings and pronounces sentence.  Court finds the defendant eligible expungement if conditions met and defendant must petition after one year.  Appeal rights given.

SENTENCE:
Count 1 - $50.00 fine + costs = $316.00
Count 2 - $200.00 fine + costs = $505.00.  $200.00 DNA SC and give DNA sample.

Eligible for expungement after one year.
1.  Defendant must petition the court.
2.  No further criminal activity.
3.  Financial obligations paid in full.
